section.title: HPE Helion 1.3 Development Platform: Deploying Non-.NET Applications

section.p: This tutorial demonstrates how to deploy a non.NET application. For the purposes of this tutorial, you'll deploy Hello World NodeJS application.

section.title: Contents
section.p: This tutorial contains the following sections:

ol.li: Any edition of Visual Studio 2013, including the Community (free) edition. Visual Studio 2013 Community Edition can be downloaded (here).
An ALS cluster on a Helion OpenStack or Public Cloud environment. See (Developer QuickStart) for information on setting up an ALS cluster on Public Cloud, see (dev quickstart).
Node.js tools for Visual Studio 2013: Install through NuGet Package Manager
Cloud Foundry Extensions: Install through NuGet Package Manager (Prerelease package for testing)
MSBuild Tasks: Install through NuGet Package Manager (From prerelease server for testing)

section.title: Creating the Hello World Node.js application
section.p: To create the sample application, do the following:

ol.li: Create a new Blank Node.js Web application
Change the following line in server.js: var port = process.env.VCAP_APP_PORT || 3000;

section.title: Deploying the application
section.p: To deploy the sample application, do the following:

ol.li: Right-click the project and select Publish to Cloud Foundry
